summary: This document is an email correspondence discussing the risk assessment of Jeffrey E. Epstein in relation to his status as a Politically Exposed Person (PEP). It highlights the need to classify Epstein as a Relative or Close Associate (RCA) of a PEP due to his connections with notable figures such as Prince Andrew and Bill Clinton, and suggests that all clients associated with him should be rated as high risk.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is discussed in the context of his PEP status and risk assessment due to his connections with high-profile individuals.

persons.name: Janice Franklin
persons.context: Franklin agrees with the assessment that Epstein should be treated as a Relative or Close Associate of a PEP.

persons.name: Gwen Hill
persons.context: Hill initiates the discussion regarding Epstein's PEP status and seeks agreement on the risk assessment.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Prince Andrew is mentioned as having a close relationship with Epstein, contributing to Epstein's high-risk status.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Clinton is referenced as another high-profile individual who has connections with Epstein, impacting his risk assessment.

connections.description: Epstein is noted to have a close relationship with Prince Andrew, which influences his risk classification.
Epstein is mentioned to have connections with Bill Clinton, affecting his risk status.

locations: 60 Wall Street, New York, NY, USA
keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein is discussed as a Wealth Management client with a high-risk status due to his connections.
Janice Franklin and Gwen Hill are AML Compliance Officers involved in the risk assessment of Epstein.
Prince Andrew and Bill Clinton are mentioned as individuals who have maintained close relationships with Epstein.
Epstein was treated as an honorary PEP in the past but was never formally escalated as such.
The email indicates that all clients associated with Epstein should be rated as high risk.
